item.description:
Chop Shop USA 2007 85 minutes

"Italian Neorealism makes an American comeback. " Movie Habit

"Bahrani's willingness to expose the shameful reality of third-world conditions in the Land of Plenty while telling a crackling good story marks him as a filmmaker as important as he is accessible. " Geesh, I just quoted the TV Guide

A street-smart orphan determined to make a better life for himself and his sixteen year-old sister spends his days working in an auto body repair shop in director Ramin Bahrani's gritty coming of age drama. Alejandro may be a young boy on the verge of adolescence, but his tough persona and driving ambition give the impression of a man twice his age. As with many street kids Alejandro has been forced to mature before his time. Now, in a disheveled junkyard on the outer edge of Queens, New York, one boy will learn what it means to become a man as he sets out to build a brighter future for the only family he knows. All Movie Guide

Now we have an American film with the raw power of City of God or Pixote, a film that does something unexpected, and inspired, and brave. Roger Ebert

Here is a link to a complete review:

This one hits pretty close to home,
Tom
